comment.author: 8543109@N02
comment._content: Eleftherios Venizelos (Wikipedia), Prime Minister of Greece 1910-1915.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Venizelos, a liberal reformer, was Prime Minister of Greece from 1910 to 1920, and from 1928 to 1932. A champion of embattled Serbia during World War I, he sided with the Entente powers against the Alliance powers that included Germany and Austria, which had attacked Serbia. In opposing Germany's war aims, Venizelos clashed with the Greek king, Constantine, a German supporter, whose wife was German. The rift between the head of state and the head of government produced a schism at the top of the Greek government.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: "Venizelos, Maker of Modern Greece," lengthy review of a newly-published biography of Venizelos -- New York Times, October 30, 1921: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9505E...
